summary: This bill, the Cyber PIVOTT Act of 2025, amends the Homeland Security Act of 2002 to establish the Providing Individuals Various Opportunities for Technical Training to Build a Skills-Based Cyber Workforce Program (PIVOTT). It directs the Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency (CISA) to partner with community colleges, technical schools, and other institutions to offer cyber education and training programs, including scholarships, internships, and a service obligation in cyber roles for graduates. The bill also includes provisions for skills-based exercises, outreach initiatives, a database of resources, and program completion benefits.  It requires reports and reviews of existing CISA programs.
